column4: ok, I tried to boot into windows with the edited menu.lst file and I get "erro 12:  Invlaid device requested"
without the typos
no, but I remember how toi undo it, and I can still boot to ubuntu
ok
one moment
same problem.  Maybe windows isn't on hd(0,0)
before I installed ubuntu, I installed windows on drive D instead of C (partitions.  only one drive)
You're adding this at the end of your menu.lst, right?  (after the "End debian automagic kernels" comment?)
Well, you should verify what HDD and partition windows are on
Open up "disks" to look
there's a "disks" something or other in one of the System menus (I don't know which one)
It is there after installed.  Uh, bother.  Times like these I wish I had a GUI.
Look for anything that looks like a disk-ish sort of thing.  I believe it's in the "administration" submenu
Hmm.  This is what, dapper? Edgy?
Eh?  i don't believe so.  Are you using LVM or anything like that?
install "gparted" and you'll be able to see.  I guess there's no partition viewer thing by default
just don't change anything ;)
then no, you don't have LVM.  Just install gparted, then you'll be able to take a gander
where are you looking?  Synaptic?
you figure out which partition Windows was on?
Alright, that's hd0,4 in GRUB
If/when you do, put windows on hda1, you'll have less headaches that way.  But, I don't know why that wasn't working
